content: two-color brioche baby blanket by jackie henderson this beautiful two-color brioche stitch is the perfect stitch to knit up for a soft squishy extra plush blanket for that little one it creates such a beautiful two-tone effect use any coordinating two color yarn as you wish and any worsted weight yarn that you desire video link to tutorial on how to do this stitch https //youtu be/6ldzs21m2rq yarn worsted weight yarn bee hobby lobby brand color a ivory color b oatmeal yardage 2 skeins 210 yards each of each color 4 skeins total needle us size 8 circular needles 24 or 36 in length gauge 4 = 15 stitches in brioche stitch final dimensions approx 30 x38 abbreviations p = purl © jackie henderson k = knit wyif = with yarn in front sl1yo = slip one yarn over brp = brioche purl brk = brioche knit pattern with color a cast on 105 stitches brioche set up row set up row 1 with color a k1 *wyif sl1yo k1* repeat to end do not turn slide work to other end set up row 2 with color b slip 1st stitch *brp sl1yo* repeat to last two stitches brp bring color b to front and slip last stitch turn work brioche repeat pattern row 1 color a p1 *sl1yo brp* repeat to last 2 stitches sl1yo p1 do not turn slide work to other end row 2 color b slip 1st stitch *brk sl1yo* repeat to last 2 stitches brk bring color b to front and slip last stitch turn work row 3 color a k1 *sl1yo brk* repeat to last 2 stitches sl1yo k1 do not turn slide work to other end row 4 color b slip 1st stitch brp sl1yo* repeat to last 2 stitches brp bring color b to front and slip last stitch turn work repeat pattern row 1-4 until piece measures approx 38 or desired length ending with row 1 bind off set up row with color b p1 *brk p1* to end of row bind off with color b with a regular bind off weave in all ends block enjoy © jackie henderson
